article_title: House Republicans Poised for Two-Week Recess Without Voting on Budget
article_text:
WASHINGTON—House Republicans prepared to leave Washington on Wednesday for a two-week recess without voting on a budget for the first time since they took control of the chamber in 2011.

House GOP leaders haven’t officially abandoned their effort to pass a budget blueprint for the fiscal year that begins Oct. 1. Last week the House Budget Committee unveiled a plan for fiscal year 2017 that it said would eliminate federal deficits...
